name: The Two Trees bloom for the first time
description: The Two Trees bloom for the first time.

name: The Valar hold council about the Elves
description: The Valar hold council about the imminent awakening of the Elves. However, Mandos declares that the time has not yet come.

name: Varda creates new stars
description: Varda creates new stars as a threat against Melkor.

name: Awakening of the Quendi
description: With the awakening of the Quendi at the shores of Cuiviénen begins the First Age of the Eruhíni. Melian comes to Beleriand.

name: Melkor's spies discover the Quendi
description: Melkor's spies discover the Quendi.

name: Oromë encounters the Quendi
description: Oromë encounters the Quendi.

name: The War of the Powers begins
description: The War of the Powers begins.

name: Attack on Angband
description: The host of the Valar partially destroys Angband and drives out Sauron. A watch is set at Cuiviénen.

name: Siege of Utumno
description: The Valar besiege Utumno. During this time many battles are fought in the North. Lands and seas change under the working forces. In the end Utumno is taken and partially destroyed.

name: Melkor is captured
description: Melkor is captured and bound with the chain Angainor.

name: Beginning of the Noon of Valinor
description: With the first of the three Valinorean Ages of Melkor's captivity begins the Noon of Valinor.

name: Stay of the three ambassadors in Valinor
description: Stay of the three ambassadors Ingwë, Finwë and Elwë in Valinor.

name: The Great Journey begins
description: The Great Journey of the Eldar to the West begins.

name: The Nandor split off
description: In the vales of Anduin a group of the Teleri splits off and turns south, to settle later at the mouths of Anduin and in Eriador. These are the Nandor.

name: Eldar reach the shores of Belegaer
description: After crossing Beleriand many Eldar reach the shores of Belegaer.

name: Elwë encounters Melian
description: Elwë encounters Melian in Nan Elmoth.

name: Noldor and Vanyar reach Aman
description: Noldor and Vanyar reach Aman and begin building Tirion upon Túna in Eldamar.

name: Tirion is completed
description: The building of Tirion is completed.

name: Gift of the White Tree Galathilion
description: Yavanna gives the Noldor the White Tree Galathilion, an image of the Tree Telperion.

name: Teleri brought to Aman
description: Ulmo brings the Teleri from Olwë's following to Aman. Elwë's friends remain in Beleriand and search for the missing Elwë. Círdan settles on the west coast and founds there in time the havens of Eglarest and Brithombar.

name: Establishment of Tol Eressëa
description: Ulmo establishes Tol Eressëa in the Bay of Eldamar as new dwelling of the Teleri.

name: Elwë and Melian dwell in Eglador
description: Elwë, now King of the Eglath, and Melian dwell in Eglador.

name: Teleri cross to Eldamar
description: The Teleri cross from Tol Eressëa to Eldamar and settle there.

name: Foundation of Alqualondë
description: Foundation of Alqualondë.

name: Vanyar move to Valmar
description: The last of the Vanyar move from Tirion to Valmar. The Noldor remain in Tirion.

name: Fëanor's birth
description: Fëanor's birth in Tirion.

name: Death of Míriel
description: Death of Fëanor's mother Míriel.

name: Fëanor marries Nerdanel
description: Fëanor marries Nerdanel.

name: Maedhros' birth
description: Maedhros' birth in Aman.

name: Discovery of gems and development of writing
description: The Noldor discover gems for the first time in Aman. First development of writing by Rúmil of Valinor.

name: Finwë marries Indis
description: Finwë marries Indis.

name: Fingolfin's birth
description: Fingolfin's birth.

name: Lúthien and Maglor's birth
description: Lúthien's birth. Maglor's birth.

name: Elu Thingol becomes lord of Beleriand
description: Elwë, now called Elu Thingol, becomes lord over all Beleriand.

name: Finarfin's birth
description: Finarfin's birth.

name: Development of Tengwar and Sindar encounter Dwarves
description: Fëanor improves Rúmil's writing system and develops the Tengwar. In Beleriand the Sindar encounter the Dwarves for the first time.

name: Marriage of Finarfin and Eärwen
description: Finwë's son Finarfin marries Olwë's daughter Eärwen.

name: Birth of various Elven princes
description: Birth of Celegorm, Caranthir, Curufin and Fingon.

name: Construction of Menegroth
description: As two ages of Melkor's captivity have already passed, Melian recommends the construction of a strong and royal fortress. The Dwarves from Belegost help Thingol in the building of Menegroth. Turgon and Finrod are born in Aman.

name: Dwarf-Sindar trade relations
description: The Dwarves from Belegost and Nogrod maintain trade relations with the Sindar in Beleriand and report to Thingol that east of the Ered Luin, creatures of Melkor are again emerging from the north and the Dark Elves are withdrawing to higher regions.

name: First Orc attacks in Beleriand
description: Wolves and Orcs reach Beleriand from the east and south. Thingol asks the Dwarves from Nogrod to forge weapons for the Sindar. The Orcs are driven away and the weapons are hoarded.

name: Peace in Beleriand and settlement of Green-elves
description: A time of peace in Beleriand and the flourishing of Eglador begins. Led by Denethor, a part of the Nandor settle in Ossiriand. These are the Green-elves. In Eglador, Daeron further develops the Cirth, already conceived before the building of Menegroth.

name: Birth of Galadriel and Aredhel
description: Galadriel's birth. Aredhel's birth.

name: Birth of Amrod and Amras
description: Birth of Amrod and Amras.

name: Melkor's captivity ends
description: Melkor's captivity ends.

name: Melkor spreads lies in Valinor
description: At this time Melkor dwells in Valinor, spreads lies among the Elves and begins to instruct many of the Noldor in his arts.

name: Fëanor begins planning the Silmarils
description: Fëanor begins planning the greatest of all elvish works: the Silmarils. Melkor, however, has no part in it. They are Fëanor's work alone.

name: Creation of the Silmarils
description: Fëanor creates the Silmarils.

name: Melkor's corruption and unrest
description: Melkor slanders the Valar before the Eldar. The Noldor begin forging weapons, furnished with the crests of different clans. Fëanor hides the Silmarils, after which Melkor lusts. Thereupon Melkor incites Fingolfin and Fëanor against each other by spreading word that Fingolfin stands higher in the favor of the Valar than Fëanor. The peace of Valinor is destroyed.

name: Fëanor's banishment
description: Fëanor is banished from Tirion by the Valar as a troublemaker. He hides the Silmarils in his newly erected fortress in Formenos, where now Finwë also dwells, after Fingolfin has become leader of the Noldor in Tirion. Tulkas is sent out to capture Melkor, but Melkor hides himself with a spell.

name: Melkor visits Formenos
description: Melkor goes to Formenos but is driven away by Fëanor. Oromë and Tulkas are sent out to find Melkor, but he flees unnoticed to the region of Avathar (south of Eldamar), where Ungoliant dwells. He persuades her to help him in the destruction of the Two Trees.

name: Destruction of the Two Trees and Kinslaying
description: Melkor and Ungoliant move unnoticed to Valinor, where at this time a harvest festival in honor of Eru is being celebrated, and destroy the Two Trees. Darkness falls upon Valinor. Melkor flees with Ungoliant northward, slays Finwë in Formenos, steals the Silmarils, escapes Oromë and Tulkas and saves himself across the Helcaraxë to the north of Middle-earth. There he again gathers his creatures around him, rebuilds Angband and erects above it the Thangorodrim. Ungoliant moves south, does not dare to enter the forest of Neldoreth because of Melian's power, and dwells in Nan Dungortheb. When Fëanor learns of his father's murder and the theft of the Silmarils, he curses Melkor and gives him the name Morgoth. Later he holds a great speech before the Elves, which reflects many of Melkor's former lies, convinces the Noldor to depart from Aman and return to Beleriand under his banner, and swears an oath that promises eternal enmity to Melkor. After their departure the Noldor commit the Kinslaying in Alqualondë, when the Teleri refuse to give the Noldor their ships.

name: Prophecy of the North
description: In the north of the Guarded Realm at the border to Araman, Mandos awaits the Noldor and speaks the Prophecy of the North. Finarfin turns back with many of his kindred, receives forgiveness from the Valar in Valimar and becomes leader of the Noldor remaining in Tirion. But Fëanor and Fingolfin continue their way northward.

name: Burning of the ships and Second Battle
description: Far in the north of Araman, Fëanor and his followers secretly cross the strait with the stolen ships of the Teleri and leave Fingolfin behind. Having arrived in Middle-earth, Fëanor burns the ships at Losgar in the Firth of Drengist. Fingolfin and his followers have only the arduous way through the ice regions of the Helcaraxë, a journey that many do not survive. At this time also occurs Morgoth's first attack on Beleriand. With Denethor's help, Thingol drives away the Orcs, but Denethor and many of his followers fall on the Amon Ereb. On their retreat to Angband many Orcs are slain by the Dwarves from Nogrod. In Mithrim at this time Fëanor is also attacked by Morgoth's host and in the conclusion of this Second Battle in the Wars of Beleriand is finally mortally wounded at the border to Dor Daedeloth by Gothmog. After Thingol's return to Menegroth, Melian surrounds Eglador with a spell, the Girdle of Melian, wherefore the realm is henceforth called Doriath, the land of the fence. Many Green-elves settle in this guarded kingdom, while those remaining in Ossiriand henceforth take part in no more battles.

name: Creation of Sun and Moon
description: The Valar create Sun and Moon. The Years of the Sun begin.
